title: Atomic Structure
content:
1

What is an atom?
  • An atom is the smallest unit of matter that retains the properties of an element.
  • An atom is made up of a nucleus and electrons.
    		•

title: Periodic Table
content: the periodic table is a table that lists all the elements in the periodic table and their properties.

title: Chemical Bonding
content: chemical bonding is the study of the forces that hold atoms together to form molecules and compounds.

title: Intermolecular Forces
content: intermolecular forces are the forces that hold molecules together.

title: Chemical Reactions
content: CHemical reactions are the processes by which atoms and molecules are rearranged to form new substances.

title: Stoichiometry
content: stoichiometry is the study of the relationships between the amounts of reactants and products in a chemical reaction.

title: States of Matter
content: States of Matter are the different forms of matter that can exist. There are three states of matter: solid, liquid, and gas.
